data.title: India's vs Sri Lanka's ODI schedule, squads, venues, match timings, telecast, live streaming details and more
data.meta_description: India and Sri Lanka will clash in a three-match ODI series commencing on August 2. Both Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are set to make their much-awaited returns to the ODI format.
data.text:
This ODI series holds added importance for India as it will be their only 50-over matches in 2024. With no ODIs played so far this year, the team will look to gain valuable match practice before facing England in the build-up to the 2025 Champions Trophy.

Let's take you through complete details of the India versus Sri Lanka's ODI series, including fixtures, squads, and timings, live streaming details and more.

ALSO READ: 'We can't give excuses': Sri Lankan captain Charith Asalanka lashes out at middle-order batters for making a mess of run chase

India vs Sri Lanka's ODI schedule

The entire India-Sri Lanka ODI series will be held at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo. The three matches are scheduled for August 2nd, 4th, and 7th, with all matches starting at 2:30 PM IST.

India's ODI squad

India: Rohit Sharma (Captain), ·èöhubman Gill (Vice-captain), Virat Kohli, KL Rahul, Rishabh Pant, Shreyas Iyer, Shivam Dube, Kuldeep Yadav, Mohd. Siraj, Washington Sundar, Arshdeep Singh, Riyan Parag, Axar Patel, Khaleel Ahmed, Harshit Rana.

Sri Lanka's ODI squad

Charith Asalanka (Captain), Kusal Mendis, Pathum Nissanka, Avishka Fernando, Nishan Madushka, Janith Liyanage, Kamindu Mendis, Sadeera Samarawickrama, Chamika Karunaratne, Wanindu Hasaranga, Maheesh Theekshana, Asitha Fernando, Matheesha Pathirana, Dilshan Madushanka, Akila Dananjaya, Dunith Wellalage

ALSO READ: Gautam Gambhir couldn't stop smiling as Rinku Singh takes his maiden T20I wicket to turn game upside down; watch video

Live Streaming and Telecast details

You can watch the India-Sri Lanka ODI series live on TV through the Sony Sports Network or stream it live on the Sony Liv app.

Notably, several members of the Indian T20I squad will be returning home as the team shifts its focus to the upcoming ODI series against Sri Lanka. Among those departing are five players who were not part of the ODI squad. Former T20I vice-captain Hardik Pandya, who was in contention for the full-time captaincy, will be heading back. Suryakumar Yadav, another key player, will also return as he is not part of the ODI setup. The list of players returning home also includes Rinku Singh, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Sanju Samson. Samson, who played both T20Is against Sri Lanka, unfortunately, departed without scoring in either match. Shubman Gill, originally in the playing XI, was replaced by Samson in the second T20I due to a neck spasm.
